name: Disruptive Mood Dysregulation Disorder (DMDD)
chief_complaint: My child has extreme temper outbursts and is always irritable
treatment: Medication (e.g., SSRIs or mood stabilizers if necessary)
prognosis: Variable; with early intervention, many children show significant improvement by adolescence
description: DMDD is a childhood condition characterized by extreme irritability, anger, and frequent, intense temper outbursts that are disproportionate to the situation. These symptoms must be present for at least 12 months in multiple settings and typically begin before age 10. The disorder can significantly impair a child's ability to function at home, school, or with peers.
risk_factors: Exposure to chronic stress or trauma
